page.title: 18A Caring Village Community
page.content: Although the Senior Residents remember Hanley Swan in the 1930's they agree that the Village today has a very caring community spirit.Recent events sprang to mind;1983's severe winter a local farmer provided milk,and another villager used his landrover to deliver food to Senior Residents.Changes have taken place,the loss of small farms, two pubs and four small shops.In particular a general shop (a wooden building which burnt down) seemed to supply everything and be a general meeting place. Sadly events like the Nov.5th bon- fire and Pig roast on the village green which have been celebrated for years and brought the villagers together have had to be cancelled as unruly outsiders made it dangerous.
